titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the war in Chechnya is of concern to the United States and that President Clinton should not attend the United States-Russia Summit in Moscow in May 1995 until the Chechen situation has been resolved.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 2/7/1995--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the war in Chechnya is of concern to the United States; and (2) President Clinton should not attend the U.S.-Russia Summit in Moscow in May 1995 until the Chechen situation has been resolved.
